level.ecm_name: Biomass boiler with 550 kW of nomimal capacity
level.description: Biomass Boiler. Wood-fuelled heating systems, also called biomass systems, burn wood pellets, chips or logs to provide warmth in a single room or to power central heating and hot water boilers.

level.application: Generation of heat to the heating and domestic hot water systems
level.advantages: Although the price of wood fuel varies considerably, it is often cheaper than other heating options. There are some carbon emissions caused by the cultivation, manufacture and transportation of the fuel, but as long as the fuel is sourced locally, these are much lower than the emissions from fossil fuels.
level.disadvantages: Biomass boilers need more space than gas or oil boilers. They need some space to store the fuel itself, such as a hopper or wood store. One of the largest disadvantages of biomass boilers is the initial investment. You will have to continuously supply the system with pellets or chips, unless you use a hopper.
level.links_to_barriers: Functional space to implement DH boilers
level.boundaries: Applicable only in buildings with baseboard heating units connected with a hot water boiler
level.installation_data: Installation must be performed according to the Boilers installation guidelines
level.maintenance_data: Maintenance must be performed according to the Boilers maintenance guidelines
